medium: High fired stoneware with impressed decor under a celadon glaze
title: Jar (kuan)
text: Kuan jars of similar shape, impressed decoration, and subtle pale green celadon glaze are generally associated with western Chin tombs. The best works are evenly potted, wheel thrown vessels with restricted decor, like the present jar.
description: wide flaring shoulder and wide mouth with a small foot; 2 pairs of decorative handles; green glaze; band of diamonds flanked by circles at shoulder
creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
